result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly conduct - domestic. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Resist/Obstruct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  Fine paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
10:30 AM; Case called for Jury status hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Joshua R Beck appeared by video.  Attorney David E Saperstein appeared by video for Joshua R Beck.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court reviews the case on the record and notes defense counsel filed a letter noting the parties have reached a resolution in the matter.  State confirms and moves to amend one Count of Disorderly conduct to a County Ordinance Disorderly conduct with the Domestic Abuse enhancer as well amend one the the Resisting or Obstructing to County Ordinance and will ask for a fine disposition.  Atty. Saperstein presents statements and is in agreement with the State's motion to amend.  Court will grant the State's motion and amend Count 1 to Disorderly Conducts County Ordinance 13-102(c)(8) with the Domestic Abuse enhancer and amend Count 4 to Resisting or Obstructing County Ordinance 13-102(c)(7).  Atty. Saperstein enters a no contest plea to the Amended Counts 1 & 4 on behalf of his client.  Court will accept the no contest plea and find the defendant guilt of the Amended Counts 1 & 4, Counts 2 and 3 to be dismissed and read in.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $367.50 (includes DA surcharge);
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 120 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.


COUNT 4:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $267.50;
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 120 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

Letter to Court dated September 8, 2022 re: agreement reached and requesting to appear via zoom, filed by Atty. Saperstein

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 8, 2022 - APPROVED.**

Jury status hearing on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Amended to Signature Bond. Refund bond to poster.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:32 AM Defendant Joshua R Beck in court with attorney David E Saperstein.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and victim key and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
